items.sentence: I couldn't help but be impressed by Tom's courage.
I don't believe Tom really wants to do that today.
I don't think Tom is saying what he really thinks.
I'm the one who warned Tom that this might happen.
I've persuaded Tom to stay in Boston until Monday.
It was dark and I couldn't see what Tom was doing.
It's a risk that Tom and I aren't willing to take.
No matter what you say, I won't change my opinion.
The hummingbird is the smallest bird in the world.
Will this set a good precedent or a bad precedent?
